â€¦  Bentley is the sporting marque: That's why it raced at Sebring. The Arnage is built to be hustled. There's amazingly little body roll considering the altitude of the center of gravity, and much grip. The Arnage has just a shade less torque than the Maybach, delivered via the meaty-sounding V8's savagely steep boost curve. It is the most dramatic performer here; indeed it's sometimes tricky to mete out the acceleration with precision. You're strapped aboard a force of nature. That's the Bentley's appeal.

The Arnage's body and interior furniture are most traditional; stately, physically heavy, obviously and delightfully handmade. There's also less space. Although you sit high, the roof is comparatively low and the windshield small, the doors and console close. You feel like a big man filling a big car.
